revision.text: ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Etymology=== {{compound|nci|yāōtl|gloss1=enemy; war|tēntli|gloss2=lip; edge|-huah|gloss3=possessor}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nci|/jaː.oːteːnwaʔ/}} ===Noun=== {{head|nci|noun|plural|yāōtēnhuahqueh|head=yāōtēnhuah}} # those near the enemy border; those on the [[front line]] #* '''16C''', [[w:Bernardino de Sahagún|Bernardino de Sahagún]], "[[w:Florentine Codex|Florentine Codex]]", book 1 #*: yn jxqujch techiaoalotoc, yn '''iautenoaque''', yn iaotenco onoque, qujnoalcaoaia yn jnmalhoan, yn jntlaaxioan #*: (All who lay surrounding, those who held the enemy borders, those who dwelt on the enemy borders brought their captives, their prisoners here.) ====Related terms==== * {{l|nci|yaotenco}} ===References=== * {{cite-book|author=Sahagún, Bernardino de|year=1981|title=Florentine Codex: Book 1 - The Gods|others=ed. and trans. by Arthur J. O. Anderson and Charles E. Dibble|edition=2nd ed., rev.|location=Salt Lake City|publisher=University of Utah Press|page=32}} [[Category:nci:People]] [[Category:nci:War]]
